page.title: 03The River Lune at Melling.
page.content: The River Lune is prone to flood over the pasture. Attempts were made to straighten the course and lessen the force on the railway bridge but it is now reverting to its old course by depositing large shingle banks. There is no road here but there used to be a ferry across. The river bailiff who lived at Arkholme had a small rowing boat in which he would ferry people across the river. He even took motor bikes across! His boat was also used for rescuing sheep caught in the floods. He died about 26 years ago and there has been no crossing since. Sometimes people cross illegally by the railway bridge. Part of this stretch of the river is now owned by Earl Peel of Leighton Hall. For a season of alternate days, fishing for salmon and trout,anglers pay 450 pounds per rod.
